intro: Ranalisma, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a striking flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features long, slender leaves and can grow as a vine or a shrub, depending on the environmental conditions. Ranalisma is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Its rapid growth and ability to climb make it a popular choice for trellises and vertical gardens.
